Activity: Arrive at work. Check emails and prioritize urgent requests. Briefly browse some art websites for inspiration, maybe look at some calming landscapes.

Review the standardized protocols and tools for assessing influenza symptoms within the EHR. Focus on understanding the workflow and data entry fields as defined by @clinlead-1 Nadia Silva. Make notes on anything unclear.
Practice using the EHR's influenza assessment tools with dummy patient data. Focus on navigating the system and familiarizing myself with data entry fields.

Email @clinlead-1 Nadia Silva to clarify a few points about the protocol, specifically concerning the standardized tools for influenza symptoms, and understand the exact data entry requirements. @clinlead-1 Topic: Clarification on Influenza Assessment Protocols.
Lunch break. Catch up with colleagues in the break room.
Shadow another Registered Nurse (@rn-1, @rn-3) for an hour during patient assessments to observe their workflow and ask questions about their experience with the EHR influenza assessment tools.

Continue practicing data entry into the EHR with simulated patient scenarios. Focus on accurate and complete documentation of demographic information, medical history, vaccination status, symptoms, and lab results.
Review my notes and create a personal checklist to ensure I don't miss any important data points during assessments. Review the data entry best practices.
Prepare for tomorrow by reviewing the daily patient schedule and identifying potential patients who may require influenza assessments.
